‘A master class in antisemitism’: Teacher on leave after complaints of conspiracy theories

A teacher at an East Bay high school remained in his classroom for two months after students complained he taught antisemitic conspiracy theories, with administrators doing nothing to counter the hate speech, according to students and teachers who spoke at a school board meeting last week.
‘Grave mistake’: Breed nominee improperly billed federal taxpayers for personal expenses

A technology executive nominated by Mayor London Breed to sit on a key city board improperly billed the federal government for personal expenses, according to a 2018 government report. His nomination raises questions about how much weight such missteps should be given years later when someone seeks a prominent public position.
